RD simulation

reaction terms

class simrd.fitzhughnagumo.FitzhughNagumo(a, b, I, tau)[source]

Fitzhugh-Nagumo neural model

\[\begin{split}\frac{du}{dt} = u-\frac{u^{3}}{3}-v+I\\ \frac{dv}{dt} = \frac{1}{\tau}(u+a-b \cdot v)\end{split}\]

  • u : Membrane potential

  • v : Recovery variable

  • t : Time

  • tau : Time scale

  • I : Constant stimulus current

  • a,b : Parameters

__init__(a, b, I, tau)[source]

initialize reaction parameter

roots()[source]

solve fixed points and keep only the roots with real values

the polynomial equation to solve

\[1 v^{3} + 0 v^{2} - (\frac{1}{b} - 1) v^{1} - (\frac{a}{b} + I) v^{0} = 0\]
Returns

roots – the fixed point(s) with real values

Return type

list

du(u, v)[source]

calculate temporal derivative of u at (u,v)

dv(u, v)[source]

calculate temporal derivative of v at (u,v)

pde solver

class simrd.srd.SRD(perturb_arr, ode=None, DuDv=(None, None))[source]

solve two-variable reaction diffusion equations on 1d grid using the py-pde solver

\[\begin{split}\frac{\partial u_{(x,t)}}{\partial t} = D_{u} \cdot \frac{\partial^2 u_{(x,t)}}{\partial x^2}+f_{u}(u_{(x,t)},v_{(x,t)})+\xi_{(x,t)}\\ \frac{\partial v_{(x,t)}}{\partial t} = D_{v} \cdot \frac{\partial^2 v_{(x,t)}}{\partial x^2}+f_{v}(u_{(x,t)},v_{(x,t)})\end{split}\]
__init__(perturb_arr, ode=None, DuDv=(None, None))[source]

initialize parameters

Parameters

  • perturb_arr (numpy.ndarray, (T,X), float) – used to construct a interpolator of noisy perturbation during simulation

  • ode (object) – an instance of a class with roots, du, dv method

  • DuDv (tuple) – diffusion rates of u, v respectively. (None,None) indicates not diffusion.

Example

ode = FitzhughNagumo(a, b, I, tau)#set reaction parameters
eq = SRD(noisearr,ode=ode)# set predetermined perturbations
arrtx = eq.solvetx()# solve partial differential equation
get_initial_state()[source]

initialize grid

Returns

initial state –

  • made up of two pde.ScalarField representing u and v respectively

  • each pde.ScalarField is a 1-dimensional (X,) Cartesian grid with unit discretization

  • periodic boundary conditions

Return type

pde.FieldCollection

evolution_rate(state, t=0)[source]

update the state by adding changes in u,v level from perturb, react, diffuse

solvetx()[source]

simulate reaction diffusion system

the simulation time is determined by shape of predetermined perturbation array

Returns

arrtx – u level during simulation time at every grid point

Return type

numpy.ndarray, (T,X), float
